title: Verify CSS Variable Theming Light Mode
description: Ensure that when the app theme is set to light mode, all UI components and styles apply the correct CSS variables and no hardcoded colors appear.

steps.description: Launch the Lila Chakra app in default (light) theme mode.
Verify that all UI components use CSS variables correctly for colors instead of hardcoded values.
Check that the colors rendered on the interface match the defined light mode CSS variable values.
Inspect key styles in 'src/css/app.scss' and 'src/pages/AnalyticsPage.vue' to confirm no hardcoded colors are present.
Confirm that SCSS files are using CSS variables for theming.

title: Verify CSS Variable Theming Dark Mode
description: Ensure that when the app theme is switched to dark mode, all UI components and styles update dynamically to use correct CSS variables reflecting dark colors.

steps.description: Switch the app theme to dark mode.
Verify that all UI components update their colors to use CSS variable values defined for dark theme.
Check visually and via style inspection that no hardcoded light colors remain in the interface.
Monitor 'src/css/app.scss' and 'src/pages/AnalyticsPage.vue' to ensure styles respond to theme changes using CSS variables.

title: Validate Reactive Chart Colors on Theme Change
description: Ensure charts on the IndexPage update their color schemes reactively according to current theme (light or dark), with no stale or incorrect color artifacts.

steps.description: Open the IndexPage of the app with light theme enabled.
Verify that the chart colors correspond exactly to the defined light theme color palette.
Switch the app theme to dark mode.
Verify that the charts update automatically to use dark mode color palette without requiring a page reload.
Switch back to light mode.
Verify charts update reactively and consistently with the light theme colors again.

title: Check No Visual Glitches On Theme Toggle
description: Verify that switching between light and dark themes does not cause any visual glitches or flickering in UI components including charts and analytics pages.

steps.description: Rapidly toggle the app theme between light and dark modes multiple times.
Confirm that UI components, including those on AnalyticsPage.vue, remain stable with no flicker or broken styles.
Ensure charts on IndexPage persistently show correct colors during and after toggling.

title: Validate Theming Responsive Styling in Production Build
description: Ensure that the production build preserves CSS variable theming functionality and reactive chart theming behaves correctly after minification and optimization.

steps.description: Run a production build of the app using the environment configuration.
Deploy and open the app in a production-like environment.
Verify that CSS variables for theming function correctly with no visual regressions.
Switch themes and observe reactive chart colors on IndexPage.
Confirm charts update correctly and no errors occur related to theming or styling.

title: Verify Error Handling When CSS Variables Are Missing
description: Simulate missing or invalid CSS variables for theme colors and verify the app handles it gracefully without crashing or major UI breakage.

steps.description: Manually remove or corrupt key CSS variables related to theming in 'src/css/app.scss'.
Launch the app and attempt to switch themes.
Verify the app shows fallback styles or meaningful error without crashing.
Ensure charts and other UI components degrade gracefully and remain functional.

title: Confirm CSS Variable Theming Consistency Across Components
description: Validate that all themed components, including AnalyticsPage and general UI components, consistently use the same set of CSS variables without discrepancies.

steps.description: Navigate through various parts of the app, especially AnalyticsPage.vue and IndexPage.vue.
Check computed styles or DOM to confirm consistent usage of CSS variables across all components.
No component should use hardcoded colors differing from the theme variables.
